member.summary: Json.NET will use a non-public default constructor before falling back to a parameterized constructor.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how dates are formatted when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.IsoDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting
member.summary: Specifies formatting options for the .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting.None
member.summary: No special formatting is applied. This is the default.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting.Indented
member.summary: Causes child objects to be indented according to the and settings.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.IArrayPool`1
member.summary: Provides an interface for using pooled arrays.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.IArrayPool`1.Rent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rent a array from the pool. This array must be returned when it is no longer needed.
member.param: The minimum required length of the array. The returned array may be longer.
member.returns: The rented array from the pool. This array must be returned when it is no longer needed.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.IArrayPool`1.Return(`0[])
member.summary: Return an array to the pool.
member.param: The array that is being returned.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.IJsonLineInfo
member.summary: Provides an interface to enable a class to return line and position information.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.IJsonLineInfo.HasLineInfo
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the class can return line information.
member.returns: true if LineNumber and LinePosition can be provided; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.IJsonLineInfo.LineNumber
member.summary: Gets the current line number.
member.value: The current line number or 0 if no line information is available (for example, HasLineInfo returns false).

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.IJsonLineInfo.LinePosition
member.summary: Gets the current line position.
member.value: The current line position or 0 if no line information is available (for example, HasLineInfo returns false).

member.summary: Instructs the how to serialize the collection.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonArrayAttribute.AllowNullItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether null items are allowed in the collection.
member.value: true if null items are allowed in the collection; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a flag indicating whether the array can contain null items

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonArrayAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified container Id.

member.summary: Gets or sets the title.

member.summary: Gets or sets the description.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.ItemConverterParameters
member.summary: The parameter list to use when constructing the described by ItemConverterType. If null, the default constructor is used. When non-null, there must be a constructor defined in the that exactly matches the number, order, and type of these parameters.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.NamingStrategyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the .
member.value: The of the .

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.NamingStrategyParameters
member.summary: The parameter list to use when constructing the described by NamingStrategyType. If null, the default constructor is used. When non-null, there must be a constructor defined in the that exactly matches the number, order, and type of these parameters.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.IsReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to preserve object references.
member.value: true to keep object reference; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.ItemIsReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to preserve collection's items references.
member.value: true to keep collection's items object references; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.ItemReferenceLoopHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference loop handling used when serializing the collection's items.
member.value: The reference loop handling.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonContainerAttribute.ItemTypeNameHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the type name handling used when serializing the collection's items.
member.value: The type name handling.
